str2: Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To do not know, be ignorant of, sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From epi and ginosko; to know upon some mark, i.e. Recognize; by implication, to become fully acquainted with, to acknowledge.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To live, be alive. A primary verb; to live.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To put to death, subdue; pass: To be in danger of death, be dead to, be rid of, be parted from. From thanatos to kill.
